source_sentence: 佛說白衣金幢二婆羅門緣起經
translation: Sutra on the Conditioned Arising of Two Brahmans, White-clad Golden Banner and Gold-clad One

source_sentence: 卷中
translation: middle of the fascicle

source_sentence: 西天譯經三藏朝奉大夫試光祿卿
translation: Xitian zhuan jing sanzang朝奉大夫試光祿卿

source_sentence: 傳法大師賜紫沙門臣施護等奉　詔譯「復次，白衣！
translation: The great master of the Dharma transmitter gave the purple ascetic ministers Shi Hu and others an imperial edict to translate it, Furthermore, white-robed!

source_sentence: 過極久遠，此界壞時，當界有情，還復往生光音天中。
translation: After a very long time, when this realm breaks down, the sentient beings in that realm will return to be born again in Ābhāsvara Heaven.

source_sentence: 過極久遠，此界成時，別界有情，光音天歿，而來生此。
translation: For a very long time after that, when this realm was formed, sentient beings from another realm came and were born in Ābhāsvara Heaven.

source_sentence: 是諸有情，各有身光，清淨皎潔騰空而行，隨欲能往，適悅快樂，如意自在。
translation: Each of these sentient beings has a body that's pure and clear, rising up into the sky and traveling according to their desires, delighted and happy, as freely as they wish.

source_sentence: 以彼有情身有光故，世界爾時，日月光明悉不出現；
translation: Because the bodies of those sentient beings had light, the light of the sun and moon did not appear in the world at that time.

source_sentence: 以其日月光不現故，星亦不現；
translation: Because the light of the sun and moon are not seen, neither are the stars.

source_sentence: 星不現故，宿亦不現；
translation: Because the stars don’t appear, neither do the constellations.

source_sentence: 宿不現故，亦不分別晝夜殊異；
translation: Because the constellations do not appear, they do not distinguish day and night.

source_sentence: 以其不分晝夜異故，年月日時，亦無差別。
translation: Because they don't distinguish between day and night, there's no distinction between year and month and day and time, either.

source_sentence: 亦復不分男女形相。
translation: Nor does it distinguish male and female forms.

source_sentence: 爾時有情，法爾自然，身光互照。
translation: At the time, sentient beings naturally illuminated each other's bodies with light.

source_sentence: 「復次，白衣！
translation: Furthermore, white robes!

source_sentence: 彼時大地大水湧現，色如酥乳，味如甘蔗，又或如蜜，香美細妙，為人所食，
translation: At that time the great waters of the earth arose, their color being like butter or milk. They tasted as sweet as sugarcane and some like honey. The fragrance was subtle and delicate; they were eaten by everyone.

source_sentence: 資益諸根，其名地味。
translation: It nourishes the faculties, which are called the taste of the earth.

source_sentence: 時一有情，於是地味，極生愛樂，舉以指端，用甞其味。
translation: One sentient being then tastes the taste of that place and becomes extremely fond of it, holding it up to the tip of his finger and using it to taste it.

source_sentence: 餘諸有情，見已亦然，起希欲想，亦以指端，舉甞其味，隨生愛樂。
translation: When other sentient beings see it, they're likewise, and give rise to thoughts of desire, holding the taste up to the tip of their finger with an ideation of desire, which gives rise to craving and pleasure.

source_sentence: 爾時有情，既於地味，極生愛樂，而為所食，資養支體。
translation: At the time, sentient beings were greatly attached to the taste of the earth and became food for its nourishment.

source_sentence: 由多食已，諸有情身，漸覺堅實，旋復麤重；
translation: Because of having eaten a great deal, the bodies of sentient beings gradually become firmer and weaker.

source_sentence: 以麤重故，不能騰空隨欲而往，身光隱沒；
translation: Because of their debilitating weakness, they cannot ascend into the sky and go wherever they wish. The light of their bodies disappears.

source_sentence: 身光沒故，爾時大地，皆悉冥暗，世間乃有日月出現；
translation: Because the light of his body disappeared, the whole earth at that time became completely dark. Then a sun and a moon appeared in the world.

source_sentence: 日月現故，星宿亦現，始分晝夜；
translation: Because the sun and moon are present, the stars and constellations are also present:

source_sentence: 既分晝夜，即有年月日時差別。
translation: Since they are divided into days and nights, there's a distinction between years, months, days, and time periods.

source_sentence: 「復次，白衣！
translation: Furthermore, white robes!

source_sentence: 彼時有情，初食地味，其味久時，為世資養。
translation: When sentient beings first ate the taste of the earth, that taste for a long time was worldly support.

source_sentence: 以彼有情貪食多者，色相瘦弱；
translation: It is because those sentient beings who desire food abundantly have thin and weak complexions.

source_sentence: 若食少者，色相充實。
translation: If they eat little, their form will be full.

source_sentence: 時，充實者，見瘦弱者，不知其故，乃作是言：『汝是瘦弱者，我是充實者。』
translation: When the rich man saw the thin man, who didn't know why he was thin and weak, he said, 'You're thin; I am the rich man.'

source_sentence: 由此乃起憍慢之想，以是緣故，地味隱沒。
translation: As a result, they give rise to thoughts of arrogance and conceit, and because of this condition, the taste of the earth disappears.

source_sentence: 爾時有情，見彼地味既隱沒已，咸唱是言：『苦哉！
translation: At that point, sentient beings saw the taste of that place as it disappeared and all called out, 'How painful!'

source_sentence: 苦哉！
translation: How painful!

source_sentence: 今此地味，何故隱沒？』
translation: Now, why is the taste of this place hidden?'

source_sentence: 「復次，白衣！
translation: Furthermore, white robes!

source_sentence: 地味既沒，地餅復生。
translation: Once the taste of the earth has disappeared, the cakes will grow again.

source_sentence: 色如飡那迦，味如甘蔗，又或如蜜，香美細妙，為人所食。
translation: Its color is like sugarcane, and its taste is like sugarcane. Or it may be like honey, with a delicate fragrance that people eat.

source_sentence: 彼時有情，次食地餅，久為資養。
translation: Those sentient beings then ate cakes made of earthenware, which they sustained for a long time.

source_sentence: 以彼有情貪食多者，色相瘦弱；
translation: It is because those sentient beings who desire food abundantly have thin and weak complexions.

source_sentence: 若食少者，色相充實。
translation: If they eat little, their form will be full.

source_sentence: 時，充實者，見瘦弱者，不知其故，乃作是言：『汝是瘦弱者，我是充實者。』
translation: When the rich man saw the thin man, who didn't know why he was thin and weak, he said, 'You're thin; I am the rich man.'

source_sentence: 由此乃起憍慢之想，以是緣故，地餅隱沒。
translation: As a result, they give rise to thoughts of arrogance and conceit, and because of this condition, the earth cakes disappear.

source_sentence: 爾時有情，見彼地餅既隱沒已，咸唱是言：『苦哉！
translation: When sentient beings saw that cake disappear, they all said, 'How painful!'

source_sentence: 苦哉！
translation: How painful!

source_sentence: 今此地餅，何故隱沒？』
translation: Why are the cakes here now hidden?'

source_sentence: 「復次，白衣！
translation: Furthermore, white robes!

source_sentence: 地餅既沒，林藤復生，如迦籠嚩迦枝，有四種色，味如甘蔗，又或如蜜，
translation: When the earth cake has disappeared, the forest-grass grows back again, resembling a cakravāḍika tree with four colors like sugarcane or some kind of honey.

source_sentence: 香美細妙，為人所食。
translation: It is fragrant and finely delicate; it is eaten by people.

source_sentence: 彼時有情，後食林藤，久為資養。
translation: Sentient beings then later ate the forest and vines, which had been sustained for a long time.

source_sentence: 以彼有情貪食多者，色相瘦弱；
translation: It is because those sentient beings who desire food abundantly have thin and weak complexions.

source_sentence: 若食少者，色相充實。
translation: If they eat little, their form will be full.

source_sentence: 時，充實者，見瘦弱者，不知其故，乃作是言：『汝是瘦弱者，我是充實者。』
translation: When the rich man saw the thin man, who didn't know why he was thin and weak, he said, 'You're thin; I am the rich man.'

source_sentence: 由此乃起憍慢之想，以是緣故，林藤隱沒。
translation: As a result, they give rise to thoughts of arrogance and conceit, and because of this condition, the forest and vines disappear.

source_sentence: 爾時有情，見彼林藤既隱沒已，咸唱是言：『苦哉！
translation: At that point, sentient beings saw that forest vine go into hiding and all called out, 'How painful!'

source_sentence: 苦哉！
translation: How painful!

source_sentence: 今此林藤，何故隱沒？』
translation: Why are the vines in this forest now hidden?'

source_sentence: 白衣！
translation: White-clothed!

source_sentence: 如今時人，或有苦法，當觸惱時，亦唱是言：『苦哉！
translation: Nowadays people sometimes have painful dharmas, and when they're touched or disturbed, they also say, 'How painful!'

source_sentence: 苦哉！』
translation: That's painful!'

source_sentence: 「復次，白衣！
translation: Furthermore, white robes!

source_sentence: 林藤既沒，香稻復生。
translation: As the forest and vines had disappeared, fragrant rice grew back.

source_sentence: 而此香稻，無糠無粃，妙香可愛。
translation: Instead, this fragrant rice has no husks or grains and is wonderfully fragrant and lovely.

source_sentence: 依時成熟，旦時刈已，暮時還生。
translation: Depending on the season, they mature. After mowing in the morning and reaping in the evening, they return to life.

source_sentence: 暮時刈已，旦時還生。
translation: After mowing it in the evening, he returns to life at sunrise.

source_sentence: 取已旋活，中無間絕。
translation: After grasping it, he turns around and revives without interruption.

source_sentence: 旦暮二時，取其香稻，但為資養，不知本因。
translation: At two o’clock in the morning and at dusk, they collected some fragrant rice to feed themselves but did not know the reason for this.

source_sentence: 彼時有情，而競貪食，以是緣故，身轉麤重，乃有男女二相差別。
translation: Sentient beings then competed for food, and because of this condition, their bodies became gross and heavy, so there were distinctions between male and female characteristics.

source_sentence: 由此有情互起憎愛，以憎愛故，互相毀謗。
translation: As a result, sentient beings become hateful to each other and disparage each other because of their hatred.

source_sentence: 又復漸起互相染著，此染著因，為過失本。
translation: Also, mutual defilement and attachment arise gradually. This defiled attachment is the root of error.

source_sentence: 又諸有情，由毀謗故，乃以杖木瓦石，互相打擊。
translation: Also, because of their disparagement, sentient beings beat each other with sticks, wooden tiles, and stones.

source_sentence: 於是世間乃生非法及不正行。
translation: As a result, unlawful and incorrect practices will arise in the world.

source_sentence: 白衣！
translation: White-clothed!

source_sentence: 如今世人，以其童女，飾以眾華，嚴諸妙服，求其異姓而用妻之。
translation: People in the world today decorate their young daughters with various flowers and adorn them with beautiful clothes. They seek a stranger’s family to marry [their wives].

source_sentence: 設此非法以為正法，然於其義，都不能知。
translation: Even if this unlawful thing were to be regarded as the right teaching, they wouldn't know its meaning.

source_sentence: 彼時有情，亦復如是。
translation: Sentient beings at that time are likewise.

source_sentence: 過去正法今為非法，過去律儀為非律儀，如是漸生諸非法行。
translation: The past right teaching is now unlawful, and the past restraints are not restraints; in this way, unlawful actions gradually arise.

source_sentence: 由起非法行故，漸生逼迫，減失厭離，旋增懈墮，或於一日、二日、三日乃至一月，
translation: As a result of their unlawful actions, they are gradually oppressed, lost and disillusioned, and in turn become lazy. For one day, two days, three days, up to one month.

source_sentence: 不住家中，不營家業，遊行曠野，覆藏過非。
translation: They don't live at home, don't do family business, travel in the wilderness, and hide what's wrong.

source_sentence: 「時，有一人，性懶惰故，不能依時，往取香稻，乃作是念：『我今何故受斯苦惱？
translation: At the time, there was a man who was lazy by nature and unable to rely on seasons. He went out to fetch some fragrant rice and thought:

source_sentence: 旦時旦時去取香稻，暮時暮時還復往取。
translation: They go out in the morning to fetch fragrant rice and return at sunrise or at dusk to fetch it again.

source_sentence: 我今若能一日一往，併取旦暮二時香稻，豈非善邪？』
translation: Now, if I were to go there once a day and take the two kinds of fragrant rice at sunrise and sunset together, wouldn't that be good or bad?'

source_sentence: 作是念已，即往併取二時香稻。
translation: After he had this thought, he went there and collected the two seasonal fragrant rice.

source_sentence: 復次，白衣！
translation: Furthermore, white-robed people!

source_sentence: 時，別一人來相謂言：『汝今同我往取香稻。』
translation: A separate person then came and said to each other, 'Now, you're going with me to fetch some fragrant rice.'

source_sentence: 懶惰者言：『汝但自往，我已取來旦暮二時所食香稻。』
translation: The lazy man said, 'Just go yourself, and I'll take the fragrant rice that you eat at two times in the morning and evening.'

source_sentence: 時，來喚者乃作是念：『日取二時所食香稻，既為善者；
translation: Then the summoner thought to himself, “The rice that you eat at two times a day is good and fragrant.

source_sentence: 我今何不一往併取二日、三日所食香稻？』
translation: Why wouldn't I take the fragrant rice that I eat for two days or three days at once?'

source_sentence: 作是念已即往併取。
translation: After he had this thought, he went there and took it together.

source_sentence: 復次，白衣！
translation: Furthermore, white-robed people!

source_sentence: 時，又一人來相謂言：『汝今同我往取香稻。』
translation: Another person then came to them and said, 'Now, you're with me going to fetch some fragrant rice.'

source_sentence: 前人答言：『汝但自往，我已取來二日、三日所食香稻。』
translation: The person before him answered, 'Just go yourself; I'll take the fragrant rice that I've eaten for two days or three days.'

source_sentence: 其人爾時，乃作是念：『一往併取二日、三日所食香稻，既為善者；
translation: It was then that the man thought to himself, “One day I am going to collect together all the fragrant rice eaten for two days and three days.

source_sentence: 我今何不一往併取四日、五日所食香稻？』
translation: Why wouldn't I take the fragrant rice that I eat for four days or five days at once?'

source_sentence: 作是念已，即往併取。
translation: After he had this thought, he went there and took it together.

source_sentence: 「復次，白衣！
translation: Furthermore, white robes!

source_sentence: 初取香稻，無糠無粃香美妙好。
translation: When he first took the fragrant rice, it had no husks or grains and was good-smelling and delicious.

source_sentence: 一懶惰者，而為因故，其後漸次，展轉多取，乃為貯積，充已受用。
translation: The first is lazy because it is the cause. Gradually and gradually afterwards, they take up a great deal of food one after another in order to store it up and use it for consumption.

source_sentence: 爾時，香稻漸生糠粃，旦時刈已暮時不生，暮時刈已旦時不生，不復還活，
translation: At that time, the grated rice gradually grows into millet. When harvested at sunrise it does not grow again in the evening; when harvested at dusk it does not grow again in the morning and is no longer alive.

source_sentence: 不知其因。
translation: They don't know the cause.

source_sentence: 彼諸有情，即共集會，互相議言：『我等初時，各有身光騰空而行，快樂自在。
translation: Those sentient beings then assembled together and discussed among themselves, saying, 'At the beginning, each of us had a body that rose into space and traveled freely, enjoying freedom.

source_sentence: 以身光故，日月星宿，光明不現，亦不分別晝夜殊異，年月日時亦無差別，
translation: Because of the light emitted from their bodies, the sun, moon, and stars do not appear. Their light does not discriminate between day and night; neither is there distinction in years, months, days, or seasons.

source_sentence: 亦復不分男女形相，法爾有情身光互照。
translation: Nor does it distinguish male and female forms, but the light of the bodies of sentient beings illuminate each other according to their mentalities.

source_sentence: 是時，大地大水湧現，色如酥乳，味如甘蔗，又或如蜜，香美細妙，為人所食，
translation: At that time the great waters of the earth rose up and flowed, their color being like butter or milk. They tasted as sweet as sugarcane or even like honey. The fragrance was subtle and delicate; they were eaten by everyone.

source_sentence: 資益諸根，其名地味。
translation: It nourishes the faculties, which are called the taste of the earth.

source_sentence: 時，一有情，見極生愛，舉以指端，用甞其味。
translation: At the time, one sentient being saw a great deal of craving and raised his fingers to taste it.

source_sentence: 餘諸有情，見已亦然，皆甞其味，咸生愛樂。
translation: All the other sentient beings who saw it did likewise, all tasted its taste and became fond of it.

source_sentence: 我等爾時，用為所食，資養支體。
translation: At the time, we used it as food to nourish our limbs.

source_sentence: 於是地味，貪食既多，我等身支，漸覺麤重，以是緣故，不能騰空隨欲而往，
translation: Because of the taste of this earth, and because there was so much craving and eating, our bodily parts gradually felt gross and heavy. For this reason they could not ascend into the sky to go wherever they wished.

source_sentence: 身光隱沒，由是世界皆悉冥暗。
translation: The light of his body disappeared, and as a result all the worlds were completely in darkness.

source_sentence: 爾時乃有日月星宿，光明出現，始分晝夜。
translation: At that time the sun, moon, stars, and constellations began to shine brightly. The duration of the day and night gradually diminished.

source_sentence: 年月日時，亦有差別。
translation: There are also distinctions in years, months, days, and seasons.

source_sentence: 是時地味，我等所食，久為資養，貪食多者，色相瘦弱；
translation: The taste of the earth at that time was what we ate for a long time to sustain us. Those who were greedy ate abundantly, with slender bodily features.

source_sentence: 若食少者，色相充實。
translation: If they eat little, their form will be full.

source_sentence: 時，充實者，見瘦弱者，起憍慢想，以是緣故，地味隱沒，地餅復生。
translation: At the time, the rich man saw the thin man and gave rise to conceit. Because of this condition, the taste of the earth disappeared and the cakes on the earth reappeared.

source_sentence: 甘美細妙，色香具足，我等所食，久為資養。
translation: They are delicious and subtle, endowed with all the colors and fragrances of great beauty. For a long time we have been feeding them.

source_sentence: 貪食多者，色相瘦弱；
translation: Those who desire food abundantly have weak physical appearance.

source_sentence: 若食少者，色相充實。
translation: If they eat little, their form will be full.

source_sentence: 時，充實者，見瘦弱者，起憍慢想，以是緣故，地餅隱沒，林藤復生。
translation: At the time, the rich man saw the thin man and gave rise to conceit. Because of this condition, the earth cake disappeared and the forest vines reappeared.

source_sentence: 甘美細妙，色香具足，我等所食，久為資養。
translation: They are delicious and subtle, endowed with all the colors and fragrances of great beauty. For a long time we have been feeding them.

source_sentence: 貪食多者，色相瘦弱；
translation: Those who desire food abundantly have weak physical appearance.

source_sentence: 若食少者，色相充實。
translation: If they eat little, their form will be full.

source_sentence: 時，充實者，見瘦弱者，起憍慢想，以是緣故，林藤隱沒，香稻復生。
translation: Seeing the thin and weak, they become arrogant and conceited. Because of this condition, the forest and vines disappear and the fragrant rice grows back.

source_sentence: 爾時香稻，無糠無粃，妙香可愛，旦時刈已暮時還生，暮時刈已旦時還生。
translation: At the time, fragrant rice had no husks or grains, and its wonderful fragrance was so sweet that it reappeared after mowing in the morning and returned in the evening. After mowing in the evening, it reappeared again in the morning.

source_sentence: 我等所食，但為資養，不知本因，貪食既多，滓穢旋礙，爾時乃有男女相異，
translation: We ate only as food for our own enjoyment and did not know the original cause. Because we were greedy with food, dust and dirt became an obstruction. At that time there was a strange sign of male and female sexuality.

source_sentence: 後起憎愛，互相毀謗。
translation: Subsequently, they give rise to feelings of hatred and disparage each other.

source_sentence: 又復漸生互相染著，此染著因，為過失本。
translation: Again, gradually arising is the cause for mutual defiled attachment. This defiled attachment is the root of error.

source_sentence: 我等爾時，互毀謗故，杖木瓦石，互相打擊。
translation: At the time, we disparaged each other, and our sticks, wooden tiles, and stones struck each other.

source_sentence: 於是世間，乃生非法，起非法故，漸生逼迫，減失厭離，旋增懈惰，一日、二日乃至一月，
translation: As a consequence, the world becomes oppressed by what is not lawful. It gradually becomes oppressed by what is not lawful. Decreases in disgust and distaste, and increases in laziness for one day, two days, or up to one month.

source_sentence: 不住家中，不營家業，遊行曠野，覆藏過非。
translation: They don't live at home, don't do family business, travel in the wilderness, and hide what's wrong.

source_sentence: 時有一人，性懶惰故，不能依時往取香稻，乃作是念：「我今何故受斯苦惱，
translation: One man, lazy by nature, could not go and fetch the fragrant rice at the proper time. So he thought:

source_sentence: 旦時旦時去取香稻，暮時暮時還復往取？
translation: At dawn, he goes out at dawn and takes the fragrant rice, and returns back at dusk and evening to take it again?

source_sentence: 我今宜應一日一往併取旦暮二時香稻。」
translation: Now, it's appropriate for me to go there once a day and collect the two kinds of fragrant rice at sunrise and sunset.

source_sentence: 作是念已，即往併取。
translation: After he had this thought, he went there and took it together.

source_sentence: 時，別一人，來相謂言：「汝今同我，往取香稻。」
translation: A separate person then came and said to each other, Now, you're the same as me, go get some fragrant rice.
